alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 8:58AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN BONNER... NORTHWESTERN KOOTENAI...NORTHEASTERN SPOKANE AND SOUTHEASTERN PEND OREILLE COUNTIES... At 857 AM PST, an area of heavy snow was located over Chattaroy, or 17 miles north of Spokane, moving east at 40 mph. Locations impacted include... Coeur d`Alene, Post Falls, Hayden, Rathdrum, Dalton Gardens, Priest River, Deer Park, Newport, Spirit Lake, Athol, Hauser, Hayden Lake, Fairwood, Chattaroy, Mead, Country Homes, Oldtown, Newman Lake, Elk, and Mount Spokane. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 432 and 452. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 0 and 18. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 294 and 334. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 166 and 177. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow. A winter weather advisory is in effect for the area. Please monitor local media outlets and the national weather service for further statements. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling. &&
